definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: There are difficulties, but being defeatist can't help.
sentences.chinese: 困難總會有，但是認輸氣餒卻於事無補。

sentences.english: Don't let first failure discweage you, try first abundance time.
sentences.chinese: 無所不能因該一次失敗就氣餒，再試一試看。

sentences.english: You should not give up though you failed the exam. All roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 即使你考試失敗，也不要氣餒，條條大路通羅馬。

sentences.english: E. g. Don't became dejected. Courage is the father of success.
sentences.chinese: 不要氣餒，勇氣是成功之父。

sentences.english: Never down, go ahead , cuz time never stops.
sentences.chinese: 不要氣餒，勇往向前，因爲時間從未停止過前進。

sentences.english: Mother was discouraged by the trouble that impended.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽因爲將要到來的麻煩而氣餒。

sentences.english: Refusing to be discouraged, Christopher took a few more breaths the next day.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗毫不氣餒，第二天又多呼吸了幾次。

sentences.english: There"s no reason to feel discouraged.
The clear message that they might keep only half of the profit from their ideas daunted inventors.
sentences.chinese: 投資人由於只能從其創新中獲得一半利潤而感到氣餒。

sentences.english: However, Margo believes that couples shouldn't despair.
sentences.chinese: 然而，瑪戈認爲夫妻雙方不應氣餒。
但是愛德華茲並不氣餒。

sentences.english: Bad credit can dishearten you in many ways .
sentences.chinese: 不良信貸可以氣餒，你在許多方面。

sentences.english: Sometimes, the narrowminded people make me frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 胸懷狹小的人，有時使我氣餒。

sentences.english: Instead of being crestfallen, he was busily engaged in planning new activities.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有氣餒，反而忙碌地計劃新行動。

definition: to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
